result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Scott Benning III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, supervision fees, and the domestic violence surcharge.
No contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint.
Successfully complete "Batterers Intervention" counseling if deemed appropriate by the agent.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Scott Benning III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
An e-mail was received from the agent indicating that there should not have been a review set because there is a warrant out for the defendant's arrest.  The defendant is in absconder status.  
Review hearing removed from calendar.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  8 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 79 days credit.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 15 MONTHS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
-Successfully complete "Batterers Intervention" counseling if deemed appropraite by the agent.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint.
-Maintain employment.
-No possession of firearms.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, supervision fees, and the domestic violence surcharge.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Robert Scott Benning in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Robert Scott Benning in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered this count dismissed and read-in to the case for the purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Robert Scott Benning in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 36.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Robert Scott Benning not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Pretrial Conference. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with STACY B., GYPSY B. OR ISAAC G.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Scott Benning in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Robert Scott Benning in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
